description: Delhi NCR has emerged as the epicentre of a nationwide wave of bomb threat hoaxes targeting schools and colleges through 2025 and early 2026. Hundreds of institutions were forced to evacuate following anonymous email threats, triggering large-scale police and emergency responses. While investigations across states consistently found no explosives, the alerts spread beyond the capital to cities such as Bengaluru, Mumbai, Jaipur and Ahmedabad, revealing coordinated patterns and significant operational strain on authorities.

description: Chris Morris views SA20 as an ideal T20 World Cup build-up, praising competitive conditions and the rise of South African players. He lauded Kagiso Rabada’s return, highlighted the rise of Jordan Hermann and Nqobani Mokoena, and stressed the value of spinners alongside seamers. Morris also acknowledges injury challenges, SA20’s transformative impact, and the enduring importance of all-rounders in modern international cricket.

description: Jasprit Bumrah celebrated a decade in international cricket, a journey marked by overcoming doubts and achieving remarkable success.  Since his 2016 debut, Bumrah has become India's premier fast bowler, amassing 486 wickets across formats. His exceptional Test record, particularly overseas, and Player of the Tournament award at the 2024 T20 World Cup highlight his enduring impact.

title: As SC allows Basant Panchami prayers and namaz at Bhojshala, recalling the dispute
'To expand like Gujarat': PM Modi's big prediction on BJP's rise in Kerala
description: Addressing a large BJP rally at the Putharikandam Maidan, PM Modi said the party’s rise in Kerala would mirror its early growth in Gujarat, where it began by winning control of a single city nearly four decades ago. He recalled that before 1987, the BJP was a marginal force in Gujarat and received little attention.

JPMorgan Chase CEO on the mistakes that still trouble him after 20 years of career
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon identified slow decision-making as his most significant career regret, emphasizing that "inertia has become an unforgivable sin" in today's rapidly evolving landscape. He highlighted the bank's aggressive AI adoption as a response to this urgency and the threat posed by agile fintech competitors.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the NDA's campaign in Tamil Nadu, asserting voters are ready to oust the "corrupt" DMK government. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin countered, accusing the NDA of betraying the state and highlighting pending demands, including financial aid and NEET exemption.

description: Bangladesh Cricket Board has again written to the ICC seeking arbitration through its independent dispute resolution committee after the world body refused to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India. Citing security concerns, the BCB has maintained it will not travel unless matches are moved to Sri Lanka. The standoff, however, was triggered by Mustafizur Rahman’s removal from the IPL over security issues.

Batting on 81, Easwaran walked out of his crease assuming a drinks break, only for the bowler to deflect a return shot onto the stumps. He called it his own mistake, ending a promising innings.

Even within states, disparities exist, with delays also noted in the crucial police verification stage, impacting overall applicant experience.

description: At least two dozen Mhow residents, primarily children, have fallen ill with jaundice after allegedly consuming contaminated water. Indore Collector Shivam Verma visited the affected areas, directing immediate water quality checks and sanitation improvements. Health teams are conducting door-to-door surveys, ensuring timely treatment for all, with no critical cases reported.

description: The Indian Rupee strengthened today against the US Dollar. This rise follows a softening of tariff threats between the US and Europe. Traders noted improved investor sentiment. However, the Rupee still faces pressure from foreign fund outflows. Experts suggest a period of consolidation and possible recovery. The 92.00 level is a key resistance point.

Amazon preparing for another round of layoffs, thousands of jobs under scanner
description: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

description: Tragedy struck in Ahmedabad as Yashrajsinh Gohil, nephew of a Rajya Sabha MP, allegedly shot his wife Rajeshwari with his licensed revolver before taking his own life. The couple, married for two months, had returned from a social event. Police are investigating the sequence of events, with initial findings suggesting accidental firing followed by suicide.

description: Stock market crash today: The Sensex began the session on a positive note, but dropped over 700 points in afternoon trade. At 2:19 PM, Nifty50 was trading at 25,064.55, down 225 points or 0.89%. BSE Sensex was at 81,549.19, down 758 points or 0.92%.

'Speeding' car crushes 5-year-old to death in Pune; CCTV video emerges
description: Tragedy struck Joy Nest Society as five-year-old Nikash Reddy was fatally struck by a speeding car while playing. New CCTV footage reveals the horrifying moments leading up to the accident. The driver, who had entered the society to drop off a friend, immediately rushed the boy to the hospital, but he was pronounced dead on arrival.

'Why are you so afraid?' SC rejects privacy plea, allows ED to access I-PAC man’s phone
description: The Supreme Court has refused to stop the ED from accessing data from an I-PAC functionary's seized mobile phone. The court questioned the plea to protect privacy, stating it knows how to safeguard innocent citizens. This comes as the ED faces challenges accessing digital devices in other money laundering cases.

title: Manipur: Meitei man visiting Kuki fiancée abducted, shot dead; attack caught on cam
description: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking outrage and fresh tensions in Manipur. The victim, M Rishikanta, was found dead near Natjang village. The perpetrators' video message read "No Peace, No Popular Government." The case is now being handed over to the NIA for investigation.

title: 'Minor incident': Massive outrage after Karnataka MP downplays tourist rape-murder
description: Koppal MP K Rajashekhar Hitnal's description of a foreign tourist's rape and murder as a "minor incident" has ignited widespread outrage. Political leaders and the public condemned the remarks, deeming them irresponsible and a downplaying of a serious law and order issue that has impacted tourism. Despite a clarification, criticism persists, with demands for a full apology.

title: Complaint filed against Palaash over Rs 40 lakh cheating case
description: A 34-year-old actor and producer has approached the police in Maharashtra’s Sangli district, alleging that he was cheated of Rs 40 lakh by composer and filmmaker Palaash Muchhal. Police confirmed on Thursday that no First Information Report (FIR) has been registered so far in the matter.

title: Magic Johnson celebrates Cookie Johnson’s 67th birthday with heartfelt message
description: Magic Johnson celebrated his wife Cookie Johnson's 67th birthday with a heartfelt social media message and a montage of photos. The post highlighted their enduring partnership of over 40 years, their shared faith, and Cookie's significant contributions as an entrepreneur and philanthropist. Their love story, which began in college, continues to inspire fans.

title: Quote of the day by Musk: 'Really pay attention to negative feedback and solicit it, particularly..'
